newsitem.title: USA: Gap Jan same-store sales rose 8 pct.
newsitem.headline: Gap Jan same-store sales rose 8 pct.

text.p: Gap Inc said its comparable store sales for January 1997 rose eight percent compared with a six percent increase in January 1996.
Gap had total sales of $288 million for the four-week period ended February 1, up 21 percent from $238 million for the comparable period ended February 3, 1996.

Sales rose 20 percent to $5.3 billion for the 52 weeks ended February 1, from $4.4 billion for the 53 weeks ended February 3, 1996. Full year comparable store sales rose five percent for fiscal 1996, compared with no increase in fiscal 1995.
As of February 1, Gap operated 1,854 stores compared with 1,680 at Feb. 3, 1996, an increase of 10 percent.
